title: Delay for Peru’s first telecoms satellite creates opportunity for the Philippines
summary: A telco in the Philippines has called dibs on a small geostationary spacecraft launching early next year that Astranis had reserved for Andesat, the cellular backhaul provider now facing delays to deploy Peru’s first dedicated telecoms satellite.

title: At Least 15 Starship Launches Needed to Execute Artemis III Lunar Landing
summary: SpaceX will need to launch at least 15 Starships to execute the Artemis III lunar landing NASA said today. Starship cannot fly directly to the Moon, but must refuel in […]

title: After upgrades, Starship is ready for second test flight
summary: With the Federal Aviation Administration and US Fish and Wildlife Service approving the final signoff and license and SpaceX saying the rocket is ready, Starship is a go for its second test flight. Liftoff is targeted for a 20 minute launch window that opens on Nov. 17 at 7:00 AM CST, following a one day slip to fix an issue with Booster 9’s grid fin actuators.

title: SpaceX Starship Integrated Flight Test 2: What to Expect
summary: After a one-day delay to replace a failed grid fin actuator, SpaceX is now less than 24 hours from the second test...

title: Starship lunar lander missions to require nearly 20 launches, NASA says
summary: As SpaceX prepares for its next Starship test flight, a NASA official said that the use of that vehicle for Artemis lunar landings will require “in the high teens” of launches, a much higher number than what the company’s leadership has previously claimed.
